cXlL4RrKFxWYjzwsy3zBOA.text: Although food from the Bella Italia chain of Italian restaurants is never really spectacular, it always pretty much satisfies you anyway. You always leave really full.   I would recommend paying a visit to Bar Napoli just up the road though, if you're already in this neck of the woods and are in the mood for Italian food.

Gen_4XqTtmN-EV0s-XG-fg.text: We visited Bella Italia a few weeks ago while visiting Edinburgh, we got greeted by a member of staff, and shown to the table near the kitchen (in the corner), but were not given any menus straight away (which i thought was strange) we waited around 5 min for someone to appear with a menu.   Anyway, once we got our menus we proceeded to order our food and drinks.   From then on, i cannot really fault any of the service or the food, or the price.   It was fairly busy for a tuesday night too, and seemed short staff, but the staff that were in managed to please us.

ZK15sm9ZYMfGTWk4V4U_ug.text: It took over 35 mins for the meal to arrive, when it did the meat was hard, you really struggled to cut it.  One guests meal was cold.   We were also sat by a wall that was known to have damp which resulted in the back of one of the gusts jackets being covered in a white residue.   I would not use this place again, yes its cheap but you do get what you pay for

4Kd3pQWQLjcupSYTvXJKbQ.text: Wanted to try Italian when in Edinburgh. In fact my wife was more keen for it. Bella Italia has a good reputation so was our first choice. Choose the Royal Mile branch and went in with my family including my 1 yr old kid. After ordering had to wait for almost 1 hour to get our food as it seems the kitchen had collapsed due to untimely exit of the chef for some personal problems. That's fine as it can happen to anyone. The only reason I am giving this low score is cause we were not informed about this and they kept us waiting. And one can understand to wait so long with a 1 yr kid.  It was almost 1 hr after we came to know and the manager was no where to be seen. Food was good and can give 3 star for that. But not pleased at all with service. Next time if I ever go will ask waiting time first and then order. I never expect this from such a reputed restaurant. No one would I assume.

h6CuriGK3Ei7z2VNL8Vgnw.text: Really nice and warm restaurant. Two floor and first floor is really confortable. Cheap price and good food for lunch and dinner.

IJ_8yR4Evp0VFtDnEMD2lw.text: We joined that restaurant when we visited Edinburgh every day. Cheap prices and very good food. The staff was always very kind.

mP2G0bdlX4F5sB536AeiHw.text: Hopeless. My microscopic (125 mls?) portion of minestrone took over a half hour to arrive. The pizza had little going for it, and then the server helped himself to a tip. Skip it.

UiOnFlwCs7hDgUCSYLKgXQ.text: Had a delicious meal. The fried risotto balls are now one of my husband's favorites. The atmosphere is comfortable and cozy. Very relaxing. Our waiter was the perfect amount attentive; never annoying. Was very happy with the experience.

FxJskEg1zEz0MNnz2da-mQ.text: I ordered from the two course meal set menu for 13 pounds where you can choose from a selection of starters, main courses, and desserts- a great deal when the pizza by itself was 10+ pounds.   I ordered the campagna pizza and the Sicilian lemon cheesecake. The pizza was thin-crust and had mozzarella, goat cheese, tomatoes, pine nutes, and caramelized onions. Overall the pizza wasn't bad but it wasn't anything special either. The lemon cheesecake in the other hand was pretty good- definitely tart with a strong lemon glaze, but refreshing nonetheless.  Service was friendly.

0WHggc6zhcV7lOlwdOrI3g.text: Fantastic service and an EXCELLENT pizza! Owner was bending over backwards to serve us and all for a 15 pound lunch.  Cant wait to go back.

EeVd6bjUI3P9IiwYWQUPYQ.text: The food was so tasty, the dessert even better! The waiters were very kind and did their best to be attentive despite how busy they get. I have no idea how they keep a smile on their face after working so hard for so long! I wish they had a location where I live- if I'm back in Scotland in the future, I'm definitely going here!   La comida era muy sabrosa, el postre aun mejor! Los camareros fueron muy amables e hicieron todo lo posible para estar atentos a pesar de lo ocupados que estan. No tengo idea de como mantienen una sonrisa en sus caras despues de trabajar tanto durante tanto tiempo. Ojala tuvieran un lugar donde yo vivo, si vuelvo a Escocia en el futuro, definitivamente voy a ir aqui.

9fHHXCYRB0TsRX0BMKZDdg.text: After many meals of Scottish fare, we were craving some pasta so we came here for lunch to satisfy the urge. The menu is simple and has all the usual expected options from an Italian menu. We all ordered different pastas, and they came to the table looking exactly the same. Luckily our server could tell them apart.   My Lenticchie pasta was al dente (very important) and the lentil and mushroom ragu gave a depth of flavor to the tomato sauce base. The portion was generous and was filling for a lunch meal. More importantly, I liked that they donate a portion of the sales to a charity. A full belly and helping others out!

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lenticchie pasta with lentil and mushroom ragu. (9.99 pounds)

imKfVbn0oIE8mEzURfRY6w.text: Trendy and lively spot.  The pizza had much to be desired.  I had the queen margherita and expected as the description detailed,  a pizza with tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella and basil sitting on top.  What I got was a cheese pizza.  The sauce was not very detectable although I know some was there and the fresh mozzarella was baked into the rest of the cheese.  Are my expectations off and too California when I want what I feel is authentic?  You know, the visible marinara and clear slices of mozzarella without the shredded cheese encumbering it?  Anyway, see photo for what they feel is a margherita pizza.  I think it's way off.  The crust seemed under cooked as well.  Just by a tiny bit.

IF1qu0DJt_JCwAimJLrzZg.text: This was a good find. They advertise a Scottish breakfast but after two weeks we just wanted something that wasn't a Scottish breakfast. My partner had the breakfast frittata with cheese and they were happy to accommodate him. I had the veggie frittata and it was perfect. Both served fresh in the very hot pan and very tasty for those of us who don't do additional salt anymore. The teat was great but the orange juice was a bit watery. I'd skip that next time. The service was by far and away above what we have experienced here, especially in Edinburgh. So if I was here again I would give this a must do again.

WVxgN6jbAU18RwSdCYdTeQ.text: It has been years since i had visited bella italia however the lure of an upgraded gf menu plus a 10 off voucher lured me and the bf in here whilst visiting the capital.  The menu is very clearly labelled which items are gluten free and there was so many to choose from. My favourite italian dish is a carbonara so it was no surprise this was my choice alongside a garlic and mozzarella pizza bread.  Oh my days ... the pizza bread was outstanding!! It has been so long since i have had a decent garlic bread and this really hit the spot. A thin and crispy base with plenty of garlic and cheese. 10/10  The carbonara was delightful too. The waiter took the time to explain that there might be a small delay in order to cook the gf pasta but to be honest we didnt really notice.  My bf had the burger and was mighty impressed.  Thank you bella italia for an impressive gluten free menu. I will definetly be back!!

oPl5Aut4hgxAcvoIXuFXBw.text: Great restaurant!!!  We met very nice and kind people over there!  The soup and salads were amazing!  Thanks for having us after closing time ;)

Vxfrn0Q8jyuZtbXOffg92w.text: Wonderful pasta and a great pizza! We had Campagne, lentichhie, and a bruschetta.  Service was good except for the wait time of 15 mins but that was lunch time and the food compensated for the time it took to come to table. Maybe it takes that much time to prepare with all the goodness! Surely worth visiting for a good Italian lunch.

tCGK8pDgHQXEUcMHdcnYlA.text: Best Breakfast what we had in Edinburgh. Their pancakes are the best. Delicious, fresh, light and fruity. Also avocado, mozzarella, tomato and pesto ciabatta. So good! And also staff is great, prices are standard.

qu1NFgnVub2CH6wYJmKl5Q.text: Stopped here because tour guide recommended.  Staff was very nice and attentive especially considering how busy they were.  We ordered carbonara and spaghetti & meat balls. They were both bland.  Side salads were nice and garlic bread was excellent.  Pizzas looked very good.  Prices were reasonable and portions were generous.

bWozfTn57KAJfykwPbfBmQ.text: Great ambience and service. Good Scottish Breakfast-used Groupon. I'd eat here again!

lSgswjtMOjubL_CKEYKG_Q.text: I've got to admit, I am a total snob about food and if you gave me a choice, you wouldn't see me in Bella Italia. But - it was my nephew's 21st. and his choice of establishment - can't be letting the side down now, can we?!  Something that always makes me nervous is a menu the size of a small encyclopaedia, which is the case with Bella Italia - but the goats cheese salad that I shared, and the sea bass that the SR had couldn't be faulted - both pleasant and well presented. In fact, everyone around our table, down to the most pickiest of eaters, all enjoyed our meals. Last but not least, we had the customary surprise cake delivery for my nephew, with cake plates and forks duly handed around.   Bella Italia - it does what it says on the tin, but at least it does it well.

xE-tz4ecbdEHdBSpzbMF0A.text: I really like this place, I've been about three times and each time the waiters are cool and the food tastes good.  I've found the service in the UK to be pretty low, but these people have American quality service and the food is as good as any place I've tried in downtown Edinburgh.

S8hMOhB4vwOP5nyRlNI3PQ.text: In need of a quick bite to eat and a glass of wine on Hanover St, my friend and I stopped by Bella Italia. We only had an hour, and thankfully didn't have to wait too long before being seated. Probably due to not have a reservation, we had the furthest away possible table upstairs next to the toilets... woo!  I ordered Pollo alla Crema, having had it a few years before and remembering it to be pretty tasty. It wasn't great, the pasta in particular, but edible and I was really hungry. My friend's bruschetta looked good though and a very geneous portion. The wines by the glass aren't cheap, but the house white I had was perfectly okay.  The service was good though, or at least it was quick! We were in a hurry, but luckily didn't have to wait too long to be served or for food.  I wouldn't recommend Bella Italia, it's chain dining at its most mediocre, but it's serviceable.

QnxsrhhOBGcQnGO-7Ghqaw.text: Not great.  Had the "low cal" pizza which was basically a pita bread with a couple of mozzerella cheese balls on top.  My friend had pasta- again just ok.  A tourist destination filled with screaming kids at lunch time.

KCi457Sw2OFQPhj3Ej8dzw.text: The other worldly pleasure that is a meal at Bella Italia!  I've eaten here quite a few times, and for an extremely busy restaurant, which also happens to be a chain, I'm repeatedly surprised by the quality of the food!  Bella Italia has two branches in Edinburgh, one at Northbridge, and my personal favourite at Hanover. Technically, there's no noticeable difference between the two branches; I'd even say the one at Northbridge looks nicer,  and has some pleasant outdoor seating for those few and cherished days when the sun shines in Edinburgh (jokes jokes...)  For some reason, I've repeatedly trekked all the way to Princes street, turned on to Hanover, and treated myself to the greatest pizzas and desserts! I've eaten here because I was bored, for a break from shopping, and then for my 19th birthday dinner! Service is great, and on one occasion, my pizza was diligently replaced (after I'd devoured half of it) when the waitress realized an ingredient was missing from my order. More pizza for me, so I wasn't complaining!  I would definitely recommend Bella for just about every dining occasion; dinner with friends, a large group, a date.. and they're also very affordable. The banoffee pie should not go untasted!   As I've written this, I'm quite tempted to head back real soon; I even managed to score a free umbrella from a member of staff last December, so I definitely feel appreciated as well!

aM3OUAdWDLNGWqne6vV9hA.text: Bella Italia seem to have been around for eternity. While more modern twists have been applied to the Italian restaurant, Bella has simply stuck to its original brief.  Expect all the usual Italian fare and with a standard level of polish. They often do a pizza/wine combo which is always there to coax the punters in, but it's just not an establishment that tempts me over the likes of Pizza Express.  This particular branch seems to be too busy most of the time and thus I often wander straight past.

NodLiSaxrXyEKOTiaAXGWw.text: Stopped in for a late lunch after a morning of sightseeing.  It was an odd hour for lunch (2:30) but the service was good.  Food was ok, not the greatest Italian I've ever had but hot and it came fast and was served with a smile, and reasonably priced, so I can't complain.
